N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 363.8 - Benefits

State Regulations
[Workers' Compensation Law, ยง201(12) ]
(a) Payment. The first payment of benefits
shall be due at the completion of the first week of disability or lesser period
for which benefits are payable and benefits for that period shall be paid
directly to the employee within four business days thereafter or within four
business days after the filing of required proof of claim, whichever is later. Thereafter, benefits shall be due and payable biweekly in like manner. Benefits
may be paid weekly. Benefits may be paid monthly or semimonthly if wages were
so paid. (b) Proration. When an
employee is concurrently eligible for benefits to be provided by more than one
employer, the liability of each employer shall be determined in the manner
provided in subdivision 2 of section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law except where proration of benefits has been
waived by one or more employers, but not by all employers. Those employers who
have not waived proration of benefits shall pay the same amount for which they
would be liable if all employers were prorating benefits. (c) Successive periods of disability. (1)

Successive periods of disability caused
by the same or related injury or sickness shall be deemed a single period of
disability if separated by less than three months only after an employee has
been paid or became entitled to be paid benefits for at least one day during
the prior occurrence of the disability. (2)

When successive periods of disability, recurring while an employee is in covered employment, or is unemployed, and in
either event is eligible for benefits, are deemed a single period of
disability, as defined in subdivision 1 of section
204
of the Workers' Compensation Law, benefits shall be paid by the latest covered
employer (or employers, if concurrently eligible for benefits to be provided by
more than one covered employer) immediately preceding the latest period of
disability, except that if such period occurs more than four weeks after
termination of employment, benefits shall be paid under section 207 by the
special fund. Notes
